definition: to put up/to build (scaffolding)/to hang (clothes on a pole)/to connect/to join/to arrange in pairs/to match/to add/to throw in (resources)/to take (boat, train)/variant of 褡[da1]

sentences.english: The carriage drove off towards London, where Jane was to join the party for home.
sentences.chinese: 马车驶往伦敦，简要在那儿搭伴和他们一起回家。

sentences.english: John and I travelled to London together.

definition: to join up with sb/to become partner/to take meals regularly in cafeteria
to go with sb/to form companionships
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
to rent a place with sb else to share the costs
(of people with tight budget) to enjoy various dishes at the restaurant by ordering the food together and then sharing the costs
to drive away cares/to relieve boredom
variant of 軋馬路|轧马路[ya4 ma3 lu4]
by the way/while out doing sth else/conveniently
(coll.) to ride in sb else's car to save money/to ride on a train or bus without buying a ticket (fare-dodging)
